NEW YORK (May 6) - The old-fashioned "Stick 'em Up" -- the broad daylight bank robbery more associated with the days of the Wild West than with modern America -- is making a comeback in New York.
 
 Criminologists first noticed the trend late last year when the sluggish economy sent the Big Apple's jobless rate soaring to its highest level in a decade. But hold-ups have tripled this year and now happen as often as three or four times a day. -AP
 
 Guns do not cause crime. It is social ills: violence, unemployment, education, etc.

post_info.post_title: Ban Guns?  No.  Ban a bad economy instead.
